column2: Development of Components from WERF Critical Selection BMPs
column50: Highlighted cells indicates material has been received.

column2: There is an additional spreadsheet describing Pollutants of Concern that could be accessed from this spreadsheet.
Note, the evaluation of ability of a Component to remove a pollutant does not reflect where water discharges. Discharge to a surface water depends on the treatment capabilities of the component.
Infiltrating stormwater following treatment will result in removal of all pollutants from surface waters, but put them into groundwater.
The removal capabilities of the component can reduce pollutant transfer to groundwater, in a manner similar that how it reduces pollutant discharge to surface water.

Information in green cells from International Stormwater Best Management Practices (BMP) Database Polutant Category Statistical Summary Report, Solid, Bacteria, Nutrients, and Metals, December 2014 ? Means no data available in ISWDB.
Infiltration devices obtain pollutant removal through a decrease in water volume from surface discharge, not necessarily through a treatment process
